means.word_mean: 1. a republic in northeastern Africa known as the United Arab Republic until 1971; site of an ancient civilization that flourished from 2600 to 30 BC
2. an ancient empire west of Israel; centered on the Nile River and ruled by a Pharaoh; figured in many events described in the Old Testament

sentences.en: Do you need a visa for Egypt?
He spent most of his childhood in Egypt.
sentences.cn: 他童年大部分时间在埃及度过。

sentences.en: He was in command of the British Army in Egypt.
sentences.cn: 他统率驻扎在埃及的英国军队。

sentences.en: Egypt was counted among the most powerful countries in the world.
sentences.cn: 埃及当时被视为世界上最强大的国家之一。

sentences.en: Britain formed a close alignment with Egypt in the last century.
sentences.cn: 英国在上个世纪与埃及结成了紧密的联盟。

sentences.en: An agricultural lobby is against a law to allow importing cotton from Egypt.
sentences.cn: 农业界院外集团,反对透过一项允许从埃及进口棉花的法律。
